  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SymbolTable(String code)
    Constructs a symbol table by detecting labels in the given assembly code and storing them in a map with their corresponding addresses.

  • Constructor Details

    • SymbolTable

      public SymbolTable(String code)
      Constructs a symbol table by detecting labels in the given assembly code and storing them in a map with their corresponding addresses.
      Parameters:
      code - the assembly code in which labels are detected and stored.

  • Method Details

    • initializeDataDeclarations

      private void initializeDataDeclarations(String[] lines, int dataStart, int dataEnd)
      Initializes the data declarations in the assembly code and adds them to the list of data declarations.
      Parameters:
      lines - the array of assembly code lines.
      dataStart - the index indicating the start of the .data section.
      dataEnd - the index indicating the end of the .data section.
      Throws:
      SyntaxException - if an unknown data type is encountered.

    • initializeTextLabels

      private void initializeTextLabels(String[] lines, int textStart)
      Initializes the text labels in the assembly code and stores them in the symbol table.
      Parameters:
      lines - the array of assembly code lines.
      textStart - the index indicating the start of the .text section.

    • getLabel

      public int getLabel(String label)
      Retrieves the address associated with the given label from the symbol table.
      Parameters:
      label - the label whose address is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      the address associated with the given label.
      Throws:
      SyntaxException - if the label is not found in the symbol table.

    • isSkippable

      public boolean isSkippable(String instruction)
      Checks if the given instruction is skippable, i.e., if it contains a label.
      Parameters:
      instruction - the instruction to be checked for skippability.
      Returns:
      true if the instruction contains a label and is skippable, false otherwise.

    • getSymbols

      public String[][] getSymbols()
      Retrieves the symbols (labels and their corresponding addresses) from the symbol table to populate a 2D array for a JTable in the user interface.
      Returns:
      a 2D array containing the labels and their addresses to be displayed in a JTable.

    • removeComments

      private String removeComments(String assemblyCode)
      Removes comments from the given assembly code string.
      Parameters:
      assemblyCode - the assembly code string from which comments are to be removed.
      Returns:
      the assembly code string without comments.

    • getDataInitializer

      public DataInitializer getDataInitializer()
      Retrieves the data initializer associated with the symbol table.
      Returns:
      the data initializer.
